channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: When is forgetting normal — and when is it worrisome? A neuroscientist weighs in
item.description: Do you have trouble remembering names or where you put your keys? Neurologist Charan Ranganath, author of Why We Remember, talks about the science of ...

item.title: Trump and Musk's breakup. And, ICE detention centers face serious overcrowding
item.description: President Trump and Elon Musk deal personal jabs in a public breakup that started over the "big, beautiful bill." And, the U.S. faces serious overcrow...

item.title: RFK Jr. is shrinking the agency that works on mental illness and addiction
item.description: The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Administration has seen its staff cut by more than a third, and it's facing deep budget cuts. Progress on overdo...

item.title: 3 years in, Sandy Hook families still wait to collect what Alex Jones owes them
item.description: The Infowars founder declared bankruptcy after families sued him for defamation and won more than a billion dollars in damages, but Jones has yet to p...

item.title: Hiring slowed in May, as employers added 139,000 jobs
item.description: U.S. employers added 139,000 jobs in May — a modest slowdown from the previous month. The unemployment rate held steady at 4.2%, as the workforce shra...

item.title: Live Updates: Trump says he's not focused on feud with Musk
item.description: The feud between Trump and Elon Musk exploded in public view Thursday, as Musk railed against the president's "big, beautiful bill."

item.title: Planet-warming emissions dropped when companies had to report them. EPA wants to end that
item.description: The Trump administration’s Environmental Protection Agency is taking aim at dozens of rules aimed at protecting the environment, including one that re...

item.title: North Korea refloats warship after failed launch
item.description: The failed launch drew harsh criticism from Kim Jong Un and led to the arrest of four officials.

item.title: Tesla shares regain ground following Musk spat with Trump
item.description: Tesla share rose in early trade after plunging 14% Thursday following a harsh online exchange between Elon Musk and President Trump.

item.title: Russia launches 'massive' strikes days after Ukrainian drone attack
item.description: Russia's drone and missile attack on Kyiv and other parts on Friday leaves at least three dead.

item.title: Israel strikes southern Beirut on eve of religious holiday
item.description: Israel's military says it was targeting an underground drone factory of armed group Hezbollah.

item.title: Employers added 139,000 jobs in May as labor market remains steady
item.description: Employers across the U.S. added 139,000 jobs in May while the nation's unemployment rate remained at 4.2%, new data shows.

item.title: Raids across Canary Islands in major cocaine gang bust
item.description: Police say smugglers used a network of speedboats to ferry drugs from South America to the Spanish islands.

item.title: Meta platforms showed hundreds of "nudify" deepfake ads, CBS News finds
item.description: Meta platforms such as Instagram have marketed AI tools that let users create sexually explicit images of real people.

item.title: Israeli army admits to Gaza strike after BBC Verify investigation
item.description: At least one Palestinian was killed and 30 others injured in the Israeli strike on tents in Khan Younis on Sunday, medics say.

item.title: Steve Bannon calls for federal investigation into Musk after split with Trump
item.description: Steve Bannon told CBS News he wants the Trump administration to probe alleged drug use by Elon Musk, and his immigration status.

item.title: A Massachusetts student arrested by ICE on his way to volleyball practice has been released
What to know as Trump administration targets tuition breaks for students without legal status
